HARRODSBURG SAVINGS INSTITUTION,
DIRECTORS,
A. M. VANARSDALL.
B. B. CAMPBELL.
JAS. TAYLOR.
R. M. DAVIS.
A. G. KYLE, PRESIDENT.
J. W. CARDWELL, CASHIER.

Harrodsburg. Ky. 22d June 1864
Gov. Bramlett Esq. Cashier
Dear Sir

The Harrodsburg Stage with Louisville & Frankfort mail was Robbed last evening 9 Miles below this about 3 1/2 Oclock P. M. Mailboys rifled Passengers Robbed of $400 in Money & 7 tickets. Two of Stage Horses taken. They also Robbed Col J D Hale & Hon W. Hawkins of a fine Gray horse & good Watch -- The Robbers consist of 5. they took a Westerly Direction from the 2d toll gate below Harrodsburg Col Hale reports to town & is now in pursuit of the thieves -- Capt H. J Barns late of 9th Ky Cav. is willing to raise 100 men for home defence If arms & amunition are furnished & proper provision Made for his Men
Respy J W. Cardwell D. P. M

Harrodsburg Mercer Co Ky
June 22 -- 1864
Cardwell J. W. D. P. M.
To the Gov. and by him referred. Informing him of the capture of the Harrodsburg stage with Louisville and Frankfort mail; which capture was made by the guerrillas on the 21st Inst.
